[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_keys] [Invalid curve points] Can PublicKey::try_from() accept points that are not on the BLS12-381 curve, and if these pass initial checks but fail during operations, could they cause consensus failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_sigs] [Invalid signature points] Can Signature::try_from() deserialize invalid G2 points that later cause pairing operations to fail unexpectedly, disrupting consensus? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_keys] [Endianness issues] Does serialization/deserialization properly handle byte order across different architectures, or could endianness mismatches lead to validators using different keys/signatures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module integration] [Validator signature forgery] Can a Byzantine validator with < 1/3 stake exploit weaknesses in BLS signature verification to forge signatures from honest validators, breaking AptosBFT safety guarantees? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module integration] [Quorum certificate forgery] Can an attacker forge a quorum certificate by exploiting BLS aggregation vulnerabilities, allowing them to commit invalid blocks and cause double-spending? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module integration] [Epoch transition attack] During validator set changes in epoch transitions, can an attacker exploit timing windows where PoPs are not yet verified to participate in consensus with unverified keys? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module integration] [Block proposal forgery] Can an attacker forge block proposal signatures by exploiting BLS signature malleability or aggregation weaknesses, allowing them to impersonate the legitimate block proposer? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module integration] [Vote aggregation manipulation] In AptosBFT voting, can an attacker manipulate which votes are aggregated to change the set of validators that appear to have voted, breaking consensus safety? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module integration] [Transaction signature forgery] Can transaction signatures be forged using BLS vulnerabilities to steal funds from user accounts? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module integration] [Validator registration attack] Can an attacker register as a validator with a malicious public key that exploits BLS weaknesses, later compromising consensus when their stake crosses the 1/3 threshold? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module integration] [Multisig governance attack] Can governance multisignatures be forged to approve malicious protocol upgrades or treasury transfers by exploiting BLS aggregation vulnerabilities? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_keys] [Hash-to-curve collision] When hashing messages to curve points, can an attacker find message collisions that map to the same curve point, enabling signature reuse across different messages? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_keys] [DST in hash-to-curve] Does the hash-to-curve implementation properly incorporate the DST to prevent cross-protocol attacks, or can signatures from one protocol be replayed in another? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_pop] [PoP hash-to-curve attack] In PoP generation, does hashing the public key to create the PoP message properly prevent an attacker from finding a different PK that hashes to the same point? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_sigs] [Hash-to-curve timing] Are hash-to-curve operations constant-time to prevent timing side-channels from leaking message information during signature generation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_keys] [Hash-to-curve to identity] Can the hash-to-curve function produce the identity element for certain messages, and if so, does this enable trivial signature forgery? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_sigs] [Pairing degeneracy] Can pairing operations with special inputs (identity, low-order points) produce degenerate results that verify incorrect signatures? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_sigs] [Pairing malleability] Can an attacker manipulate pairing inputs to produce the same pairing result with different signatures, enabling signature malleability attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_sigs] [Multi-pairing security] In aggregate signature verification using multiple pairings, can the order or combination of pairings be manipulated to verify invalid signatures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_sigs] [Pairing batch verification] If batch pairing operations are used for performance, can an attacker exploit batching to make invalid signatures appear valid when verified in a batch? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_keys] [Message serialization non-determinism] Does signing_message() produce deterministic output for all message types, or can an attacker find objects that serialize differently on different nodes, causing signature verification mismatches? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_sigs] [BCS serialization attack] Can an attacker craft message types that exploit BCS serialization behavior to create collision attacks or verification bypasses? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_keys] [CryptoHash collision] If the CryptoHash trait implementation has collisions, can different messages produce the same hash and thus the same signature, enabling signature reuse? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_sigs] [Message length extension] Can an attacker append data to a message after signing such that the extended message verifies with the same signature, bypassing intended message boundaries? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_keys] [Validator key rotation] During validator key rotation, can an attacker exploit timing windows to use old unverified keys or cause signature verification with mismatched keys? (High)
